content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE metadata SYSTEM "http://thor-f5.er.usgs.gov/ngtoc/metadata/fgdc-std-001-1998.dtd"> <metadata>   <idinfo>     <citation>       <citeinfo>         <origin>U.S. Geological Survey</origin>         <pubdate>200509</pubdate>         <title>USGS Small-scale Dataset - Grayscale Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands Shaded Relief - 200- Meter Resolution, Albers projection 200509 GeoTIFF</title>         <geoform>Map</geoform>         <pubinfo>           <pubplace>Reston, VA</pubplace>           <publish>U.S. Geological Survey</publish>         </pubinfo>         <onlink>http://dds.cr.usgs.gov/pub/data/nationalatlas/srgypri200a_nt00330.tar.gz</onlink>         <lworkcit>           <citeinfo>             <origin>U.S. Geological Survey</origin>             <pubdate>2013</pubdate>             <title>Small-scale Datasets</title>             <onlink>https://www.sciencebase.gov/catalog/item/532c5b23e4b0cd7393d07783</onlink>           </citeinfo>         </lworkcit>       </citeinfo>     </citation>     <descript>       <abstract> The grayscale Puerto Rico and U.S. Virgin Islands shaded relief data were  derived from National Elevation Dataset (NED) data, and show the terrain  of Puerto Rico and U.S. Virgin Islands at a resolution of 200 meters.  The  NED is a raster product assembled by the U.S. Geological Survey, designed  to provide national elevation data in a seamless form with a consistent  datum, elevation unit, and projection.  Data corrections made in the  NED assembly process minimize artifacts, permit edge matching, and fill  sliver areas of missing data.  The National Atlas also includes a Lambert  Azimuthal Equal Area projection shaded relief file; this file is the same  data in an Albers projection.  </abstract>       <purpose> The grayscale shaded relief images were developed to portray the terrain  of the United States.  They are intended for visual purposes only.  The  original NED data must be used for conducting analysis and determining  elevation values.  </purpose>       <supplinf> The associated world file is included as part of the GeoTIFF.  The  contents of the world file are:  >200.0000  >0.000000  >0.000000  >-200.0000  >-195900.0000  >437900.0000    The following projection file can be used when using ESRI's ArcGIS to view  the GeoTIFF (any line breaks should be removed):  PROJCS["Albers_NAD_1983_PRVI",GEOGCS["GCS_North_American_1983",  DATUM["D_North_American_1983",SPHEROID["GRS_1980",6378137.0,  298.257222101]],PRIMEM["Greenwich",0.0],UNIT["Degree",  0.0174532925199433]],PROJECTION["Albers"],PARAMETER["False_Easting",  0.0],PARAMETER["False_Northing",0.0],PARAMETER["Central_Meridian",-  66.5],PARAMETER["Standard_Parallel_1",8.0],PARAMETER  ["Standard_Parallel_2",18.0],PARAMETER["Latitude_Of_Origin",15.0],  UNIT["Meter",1.0]]  ; {"gdaId" : 6065753}</supplinf>     </descript>     <timeperd>       <timeinfo>         <sngdate>           <caldate>200603</caldate>         </sngdate>       </timeinfo>       <current>Publication date</current>     </timeperd>     <status>       <progress>Complete</progress>       <update>None planned</update>     </status>     <spdom>       <bounding>         <westbc>-69</westbc>         <eastbc>-63</eastbc>         <northbc>21</northbc>         <southbc>15</southbc>       </bounding>     </spdom>     <keywords>       <theme>         <themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Category</themekt>         <themekey>elevation</themekey>         <themekey>imageryBaseMapsEarthCover</themekey>       </theme>       <theme>         <themekt>None</themekt>         <themekey>National Atlas of the United States</themekey>         <themekey>Digital Elevation Model</themekey>         <themekey>Shaded Relief</themekey>         <themekey>Topography</themekey>         <themekey>Topographic</themekey>         <themekey>DEM</themekey>         <themekey>NED</themekey>       </theme>       <theme>         <themekt>The National Map Collection Thesaurus</themekt>         <themekey>Small-scale Datasets</themekey>         <themekey>Small-scale Datasets - performed on this map layer.</logic>     <complete>Data completeness reflects the content of the original NED elevation data.</complete>     <lineage>       <srcinfo>         <srccite> <title>Shoreline file in Lambert Azimuthal Equal Area projection</title>             <pubinfo>               <pubplace>Reston, VA</pubplace>               <publish>National Atlas of the United States</publish>             </pubinfo>           </citeinfo>         </srccite>         <typesrc>Internal file</typesrc>         <srctime>           <timeinfo>             <rngdates>               <begdate>1972</begdate>               <enddate>1999</enddate>             </rngdates>           </timeinfo>           <srccurr>Ground condition</srccurr>         </srctime>         <srccitea>shorelp020l</srccitea>         <srccontr>Shoreline mask for area of coverage.</srccontr>       </srcinfo>       <procstep>         <procdesc> Four elevation mosaics were extracted from the National Elevation  Dataset (NED) and used to produce the shaded relief images of the  conterminous United States, Alaska, Hawaii, and Puerto Rico and the U.S.  Virgin Islands.  A separate image was created for each of the four  areas because, at 200-meter resolution, file size for an elevation  mosaic of all of the United States would exceed the processing capacity  of some commonly-used GIS and image processing software packages.    For Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands, elevation data were  extracted from the NED and projected to an Albers Conical Equal-Area  projection, with a pixel size of 200 meters.  The datum for NED data is  NAD83, except for Alaska which uses NAD27.    Using the ArcInfo Polygrid command, a 0/1 land/water mask was created  for Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands at the same 200 meter  resolution as the elevation data, using coastline data clipped from the  National Atlas shoreline file.  The land/water mask was applied to the  16-bit elevation grid.  The masked elevation grid as well as the mask  itself is available on request.  More information on the NED may be  found by following the links at http://ned.usgs.gov.    Shaded relief was created from the masked land/water elevation data set  using the ArcInfo Hillshade command with these  parameters:  >Azimuth 315 degrees  >Sun angle 45 degrees  >Vertical exaggeration factor 10    A second mask that separated U.S. land from non-U.S. land was created  with ArcInfo Polygrid, then applied to the shaded relief image in  Adobe Photoshop.  Oceans were set to (0,0,0) and non-U.S. land was set  to (182,182,182).  The masked image from Photoshop was saved as a TIFF,  ingested into ArcInfo 's Grid module, saved as a TIFF from ArcInfo, and  then processed through a USGS GeoTIFF software program to create a  fully-compliant GeoTIFF with valid header information.  </procdesc>         <srcused>National Elevation Dataset</srcused>         <srcused>shorelp020l</srcused>         <procdate>2004</procdate>       </procstep>     </lineage>   </dataqual>   <spdoinfo>     <direct>Raster</direct>     <rastinfo>       <rasttype>Grid Cell</rasttype>       <rowcount>1040</rowcount>       <colcount>2410</colcount>  </mapproj>         <planci>           <plance>row and column</plance>           <coordrep>             <absres>200.0</absres>             <ordres>200.0</ordres>           </coordrep>
